alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 2:53PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Temperatures remain warm enough to continue active snowmelt in the mountains through much of this week. The melting snow will lead to continued high water flows on smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Salt River within Star Valley. Ponding of water in low-lying areas is likely to persist through the week. For the Salt River Basin...including Etna...minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding. * WHERE...Salt River near Etna. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Monitor high water along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Small creeks and streams are flooding in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of ranchland/pastureland near Etna. At 5.5 feet, Flood stage. Low land flooding along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Low land flooding becomes more widespread upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of pastureland/ranchland. At 6.0 feet, Extensive low land flooding in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Extensive low land flooding upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of farm/ranch houses upstream and downstream of gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM MDT Monday, May 22, the stage was hovering around 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near flood stage with an expected crest around 5.7 feet Thursday. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive around barricades. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water and could easily collapse. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/riverton.
